alert.note: Alert for Greene; Madison; Page; Rappahannock; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 08 at 4:16PM EDT until June 08 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, northern Virginia, northwest Virginia and western Virginia, including the following areas: in central Virginia, Greene, Orange and Spotsylvania. In northern Virginia, Culpeper, Northern Fauquier, Prince William/Manassas/Manassas Park, Southern Fauquier and Stafford. In northwest Virginia, Madison, Northern Virginia Blue Ridge, Page, Rappahannock, Shenandoah and Warren. In western Virginia, Rockingham. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Numerous showers and thunderstorms with heavy rain are expected through this evening and into the overnight. Rainfall rates of 2 inches per hour are possible, leading to the potential for flash flooding especially in areas that see multiple rounds of heavy rain. - Please visit https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Greene; Madison; Page; Rappahannock; Rockingham; Shenandoah; Warren
